alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 3:56PM CDT until June 06 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Van Buren County in southeastern Iowa... Southern Jefferson County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 355 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Batavia to near Milton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Milton around 400 PM CDT. Libertyville and Lebanon around 405 PM CDT. Cantril and Douds around 410 PM CDT. Lake Sugema Campground, Lacey Keosauqua State Park and Collett around 415 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Keosauqua, Birmingham, Keosauqua Airport, Van Buren County Fairgrounds, Mount Zion, Mount Sterling, Stockport, Bentonsport/Vernon, Round Prairie Park, Morris Park, Bonaparte and Glasgow. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
